meanings.definition: A mass of small bubbles formed in or on a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The froth on top of the hot chocolate looked so fluffy.
meanings.sent2: The beer had a thick froth on the surface.
meanings.sent3: The froth on the soda made it seem like a bubbly party drink.
meanings.sent4: The froth of the waves crashing against the shore was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The froth of the milk in the latte made it extra creamy.

meanings.sent1: The froth of gossip at school was hard to ignore.
meanings.sent2: His promises were just froth, with no real intention behind them.
meanings.sent3: The froth of excitement over the new movie release was contagious.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was full of froth, lacking any real substance.
meanings.sent5: The froth of laughter filled the room during the comedy show.
